notes: A brief encounter between government soldiers and New People's Army (NPA) rebels erupted on Nov 1 evening assumed in an area around Barangay Malawaan area, Rizal town, Occidental Mindoro. No casualties reported. Pursuit operations are still ongoing.
Two remnants of the combined Maute Group-Abu Sayyaf force were killed while two soldiers were wounded in a clash that erupted at the main battle area in Marawi City on Nov 1.

Property destruction: Around 20 to 30 members of the New People's Army (NPA) allegedly stormed the compound of the Bluemax Tradelink Inc., located in Barangay Malawaan, Rizal town, Occidental Mindoro on Nov 1 and burnt heavy equipment.

source: Foundation for Media Alternatives; Philippine Star
notes: A drug suspect was shot dead in a vigilante-style attack by an unidentified armed man assumed at Barangay Lublubba, Dolores, Abra on Nov 2.
A lone remnant of the combined Maute Group-Abu Sayyaf force was shot at by security forces while trying to escape Marawi City on Nov 2. The militant managed to hide in a suspected tunnel.

source: Foundation for Media Alternatives; Philippine Daily Inquirer
notes: A drug suspect was shot dead in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified armed men inside his house at Phase 9, Bagong Silang, Caloocan City on Nov 2 night.

source: Foundation for Media Alternatives; Philippine Star
notes: Two drug suspects were killed presumably by vigilantes in their house in Barangay Cauyan, Angeles, Pampanga. Their bodies were found on Nov 2.

Dozens of families of enforced disappearances and extra-judicial killings (EJK) victims gathered at the Bantayog ng mga Bayani Memorial Centre in Quezon City, Manila on Nov 2, to call for a stop to state violence.

source: Philippine Star; Foundation for Media Alternatives
notes: A 14-year-old drug suspect was shot dead in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified armed men in Barangay Calzada Tipas, Taguig City on Nov 3 night.
An undetermined number of suspected New People's Army rebels attacked the Gubat, Sorsogon Municipal Police Station on Nov 3 night. No casualties reported.
Alleged members of the NPA assaulted a police headquarters located in Barangay San Mateo, Butuan City, Agusan del Norte province on November 3, 2017.
A former barangay councilor of Kapatagan, Lanao del Norte, who was active in the government's war against drugs was shot dead by unidentified men on his way home on Nov 3.

actor2: Military Forces of the Philippines (2016-) Citizen Armed Force Geographical Unit
notes: Abu Sayyaf militants reportedly beheaded two militiamen in Basilan province on Nov 3.

source: Manila Times; Foundation for Media Alternatives
notes: A drug suspect was killed during a police raid at Malabuyoc, Cebu on 04 Nov 2017.
A drug suspect was killed during a police raid at Carmen, Cebu on 05 Nov 2017.
Security forces killed 11 rebel fighters belonging to the Maute Group-Abu Sayyaf force that besieged Marawi City in day-long clashes on Nov 5 during clearing operations in the city.

assoc_actor_2: Military Forces of the Philippines (2016-) Citizen Armed Force Geographical Unit
notes: Militiamen and soldiers of the 20th Special Forces Company encountered around 40 suspected members of a renegade faction of the Moro Islamic Liberation Front (MILF) at Sitio Balas, Barangay Poblacion, Kalawit area, Zamboanga del Norte on Nov 5. Two members of the MILF lost command and a militiaman died in the clash.
A drug suspect was killed in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified gunmen at Cebu City, Cebu on 05 Nov 2017.

Several members of the opposition and former Vice President Jejomar 'Jojo' Binay joined the mass and march along the historic EDSA in Metro Manila on Nov 5, against extrajudicial killings under the government's war on drugs.

Groups under the Kalikasan-People's Network for the Environment (Kalikasan-PNE) held a protest rally in front of the Department of Environment and Natural Resources (DENR) assumed in Quezon City, Manila on Nov 6, to protest the reported move to lift the ban on open-pit mining.
A drug suspect was killed in a vigilante-style attack by alleged armed drug suspects and alleged members of the Sandaya Drug group at Mandaue, Cebu on 7 Nov 2017.

assoc_actor_2: Military Forces of the Philippines (2016-) Citizen Armed Force Geographical Unit
notes: A soldier and two militiamen were killed in an encounter with New People's Army (NPA) rebels in Barangay San Isidro, Lianga, Surigao del Sur on Nov 7.

The SOS Network with education advocates staged a protest outside the Department of Education (assumed in Pasig City, Manila) on November 7, against the presence of soldiers in indigenous alternative schools.

The Army's 61st Infantry Battalion encountered 30 suspected members of the New People's Army (NPA) at Sitio Tigpaka Daku, Barangay Putian, Cuartero, Capiz on Nov 7. Three rebels, one of them a former student leader, were killed.

Dozens of protesters burnt a portrait of US President Donald Trump in downtown Manila on Nov 7 in a protest against his upcoming visit to join a summit of East Asian leaders. Members of Kadamay, an alliance of urban poor activists, camped out at a bridge near the presidential palace.

An improvised bomb exploded at Sitio Lagasan, Barangay Kulay Bato, Lamitan City, Basilan on Nov 7 night, no injuries reported. Responding elements of the 64th Infantry Battalion and Explosive Ordnance Disposal unit recovered another improvised explosive device (IED) on the scene. Abu Sayyaf group is believed to be behind the IEDs.

assoc_actor_2: Farmers (Philippines); KMP: Kilusang Magbubukid ng Pilipinas
source: ProtectDefenders.eu; Karapatan; Front Line Defenders; Panay News
notes: A farmer and council member of the Kilusang Magbubukid ng Pilipinas (KMP) was shot dead by suspected military agents on 8 Nov 2017, in Kabankalan city, Negros Occidental as reported by the human rights organization Karapatan.

08 November. The Army's 18th Infantry Battalion clashed with members of the Abu Sayyaf Group (ASG) under Siar Alhamsirol and Parong Tedi at Barangay Upper Cabengbeng, Sumisip, Basilan on Nov 8. The Air Force provided close air support to the soldiers. 6 soldiers and an undetermined numbers of militants (coded as 3) were killed in a series of firefights.

About 300 survivors of Super typhoon 'Yolanda' held a protest rally assumed at Botongon village, Estancia town area, Iloilo on Nov 8 to mark the fourth anniversary of the disaster and seek compensation and adequate rehabilitation.
The Army's 50th Infantry Battalion encountered NPA rebels in a 2-hours firefight in Balbalan area, Kalinga on Nov 8. No casualties reported.

08 November. The military launched airstrikes targeting the group of Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Fighters under Esmael Abulmalik at the remote village of Bentangan, Carmen town, North Cotabato province on Nov 8. The strikes were backed by ground troops from the 7th Infantry Battalion and artillery offensives. There were reports of casualties from the strike.

08 November. The military launched airstrikes targeting the group of Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Fighters under Esmael Abulmalik at the remote village of Tonganon, Carmen town, North Cotabato province on Nov 8. The strikes were backed by ground troops from the 7th Infantry Battalion and artillery offensives. There were reports of casualties from the strike.
Communist rebels killed a child and a policeman and wounded five others, one of them a municipal police chief, in an ambush at Barangay Tikalaan, Talakag, Bukidnon on Nov 9.

The League of Filipino Students in Northern Mindanao Region (LFS-NMR) joined other youth groups in the country in staging protest actions at the Magsaysay Park in Cagayan de Oro City on November 9 morning against US President Donald Trump upcoming visit to join a summit of East Asian leaders.

Soldiers of the 84th Infantry Battalion engaged a undetermined number of suspected communist rebels t Barangay Sanguit, Dupax Del Sur town in Nueva Vizcaya on Nov 9. One rebel was killed while 11 Army soldiers were wounded.

actor2: Military Forces of the Philippines (2016-) Citizen Armed Force Geographical Unit
notes: Two militiamen of the Citizen Armed Forces Geographical Unit Active Auxiliary were killed in an ambush staged by suspected Abu Sayyaf militants at Barangay Libug, Tuburan, Basilan on Nov 10.
Government troops encountered Abu Sayyaf militants led by Indang Susukan in Barangay Lagasan Higad, Parang, Sulu on Nov 10. No casualties reported.
Property Destruction: Unidentified men set ablaze a Catholic chapel in Barangay Labo-Labo, Shariff Aguak area, Maguindanao on Nov 10 night.

10 November. Government troops stormed a Abu Sayyaf lair near Languyan town area, Tawi-Tawi on Nov 10 morning and rescued four remaining Vietnamese kidnap victims. The fifth Vietnamese was found dead inside the lair. He had apparently succumbed to a illness.

Leftist activists marched to the US Embassy in Manila on Nov 10, to protest the upcoming visit of US President Donald Trump, who will attend a South-East Asian leaders' summit in Manila. Anti-riot police officers blocked the demonstrators before they reached the embassy compound, raising tensions as the protesters tried to push their way in.
More than a hundred farmers held a protest rally in front of PhilRice's gate at Maligaya, Munoz, Nueva Ecija on Nov 10 for its renewed push to open field test and feed test Golden Rice.

Members of the Bagong Alyansang Makabayan held a protest outside Trump Tower skyscraper in Makati, Metro Manila assumed on Nov 10, against the upcoming visit of US President Donald Trump, who will attend a South-East Asian leaders' summit in Manila.
Two drug suspects were killed in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified gunmen at Taguig, Metro Manila on 10 Nov 2017.

Around 40 small farmers and farmworkers from Indonesia, Philippines, and Thailand marched from the University of the Philippines' Oblation statue to the Commission on Human Rights (CHR) in Quezon City, Manila on Nov 11, to urge ASEAN governments to respect, protect, and promote the right to land and access to justice of farmers and peasants in the region.

Hundreds of demonstrators staged a rally in central Manila on Saturday (November 11) to demonstration against the visit of U.S. President Donald Trump for a regional meeting. The demonstrators, mainly left wing activists, scuffled briefly with anti-riot police.

actor1: Police Forces of the Philippines (2016-) Philippine Drug Enforcement Agency
notes: A drug suspect was wounded in a shootout between 5 drug suspects (including 4 army soldiers) and PDEA agents in Barangay Magugpo West, Tagum City in Davao del Norte on Nov 11. All 5 were arrested following the shootout.

The Army's 5th Regional Public Safety Battalion and 3rd Manoeuvre Platoon were ambushed by NPA rebels on their way to Barangay Buyo, San Fernando, Masbate on Nov 12. One police officer was killed and another injured.

Hundreds of left-wing activists tried to hold an anti-Donald Trump demonstration at the US Embassy in Manila on Nov 12. At least 20 demonstrators were injured in the brief scuffle with riot police and one was arrested. The demonstrators dispersed after burning a mock US flag.
The Army's 24th Infantry Battalion encountered NPA rebels at remote Barangay Alangtin, Tubo, Abra on Nov 12, leaving 2 soldiers wounded.

A member of the Moro National Liberation Front (MNLF) shot dead a member of the Moro Islamic Liberation Front (MILF), Tony Pulalon, in Matalam town, North Cotabato on Nov 12. Following the incident armed clashes erupted between members of the Moro National Liberation Front (MNLF) and the Moro Islamic Liberation Front (MILF) in Matalam town, North Cotabato. Four people were injured in the skirmishes.

source: Foundation for Media Alternatives; Manila Bulletin
notes: A robbery suspect was shot dead in a vigilante-style attack by 2 unidentified armed men at Brgy. Commonwealth, Quezon City, Metro Manila, on 12 Nov 2017.

About 30 members of progressive youth organizations led by Anakbayan conducted a protest rally in front of the Mall of Asia (MOA) globe in Pasay City on Nov 12 simultaneous with the ASEAN summit gala.
A protest was held in Angeles, Pampanga on Nov 12 before Us President Donald Trump's arrival in the Clark International Airport.
The Army's 86th Infantry Battalion encountered around 30 NPA rebels at in Sitio Minanga, Barangay San Carlos, Echague, Isabela on Nov 12. One soldier was killed.
Arrests: Police intelligence units arrested an alleged leader of the New People's Army at his hideout in Barangay National, Jimenez town area, Misamis Occidental on November 12.
Suspected New People's Army (NPA) rebels abducted two police officers at Barangay Bad-as, Placer, Surigao del Norte on November 13.

Hundreds of leftist activists, farmers and students staged clashed with the police's dispersal teams close to the US Embassy in Manila on Nov 13, during a demonstration opposing US President Donald Trump's attendance to the Association of Southeast Asian Nations Summit (ASEAN). The police resorted to the use of water cannons. Several demonstrators and policemen were injured.
Suspected guerrillas of the New People's Army (NPA) shot and killed a policeman at remote New Valencia village in Tugbok district, Davao City on Nov 13.
A village executive was shot dead by unidentified gunmen in in Sitio Daan-Lungsod, Barangay Sto. Cristo, Uson town, Masbate on Nov 13 or Nov 14. The motive is still under investigation.

Members of activist groups, led by members of Bagong Alyansang Makabayan and the Makabayan-bloc of party-list lawmakers, gathered at the Mendiola peace arch in Manila on Nov 14, opposing US President Donald Trump's attendance to the Association of Southeast Asian Nations Summit (ASEAN) and against the summit itself.
The Army's 83rd Infantry Battalion encountered NPA rebels at Barangay Balanac, Ligao, Albay on November 14, leaving one soldier dead.

At least 100 people belonging to the Bagong Alyansang Makabayan Negros and its allied organizations staged a protest in Bacolod City on Nov 14, opposing US President Donald Trump's attendance to the Association of Southeast Asian Nations Summit (ASEAN).
Six locals were abducted by armed men believed to be members of the Abu Sayyaf at Brgy. Latih, Patikul town, Sulu on November 14 evening.
The Army's 72nd Infantry Battalion encountered NPA rebels in a 10-minute firefight at Barangay Sanguit, Dupax del Sur town, Nueva Vizcaya province on November 14. No casualties reported.
A village chairman was shot dead by unidentified gunmen in Barangay Ilayang in Lucena, Quezon on Nov 14. The motive is still under investigation.
Property destruction: Around 30 NPA rebels guerrillas set up a road blockade in Sitio Banga, Barangay Cuyago, Jabonga, Agusan del Norte and burnt two trucks on November 14. No one was injured.

Agreement: Leaders of seven heavily-armed Iranun clans of the Dagalangit, Malambut, Tomawis, Maricor and Aron families and their enemies, the Minis, Bangon, and Baroto families agreed on a settlement to end the decades-long clan feud that took many lives. The settlement was held in Buluan town, Maguindanao on November 15.

Militant farmers staged a rally and forcibly stormed a contested property inside the former sugar estate in Tarlac on November 15, the eve of the so-called Hacienda Luisita massacre in 2004. One activist was detained by the police. They then demonstrated at Camp Macabulos in Tarlac City against the arrest of the activist.

The military launched airstrikes and ground operations against ISIS-inspired Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Fighters (BIFF) in the village of Timbangan, Shariff Aguak, Maguindanao early on Nov 15. No casualties reported.

source: Philippine Daily Inquirer; Foundation for Media Alternatives
notes: A drug suspect was shot dead in a vigilante-style attack by an unidentified gunman at Barangay Lawaan, Talisay City, Cebu on November 15.
Suspected New People's Army (NPA) rebels shot dead an off-duty jail guard at Barangay Matagangtang, Placer, Masbate on November 15.

The military launched airstrikes and ground operations against ISIS-inspired Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Fighters (BIFF) in the village of Meta, Datu Unsay, Maguindanao early on Nov 15. No casualties reported.

source: Foundation for Media Alternatives; Philippine Daily Inquirer
notes: A drug suspect was killed in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified gunmen at Quezon City, Metro Manila on 15 Nov 2017.

actor1: Military Forces of the Philippines (2016-) Citizen Armed Force Geographical Unit
assoc_actor_2: Christian Group (Philippines); KMP: Kilusang Magbubukid ng Pilipinas; Farmers (Philippines)
source: ABS CBN; ProtectDefenders.eu; Front Line Defenders; Bulatlat
notes: A United Church of Christ of the Philippines pastor and leader of the Unyon sa mga Mag-uuma sa Agusan del Norte (UMAN) affiliated to KMP was shot dead by suspected paramilitary elements (assumed CAFGU) on 16 Nov 2017 at Jabonga or Kitcharao town, Agusan del Norte.
A former municipal councillor was shot dead by unidentified gunmen in Barangay Concepcion, San Simon town in Pampanga on Nov 16. The motive is still under investigation.

source: Northbound Philippines News Online; Foundation for Media Alternatives
notes: A drug suspect was killed during a police raid at San Jose del Monte, Bulacan on 16 Nov 2017.

16 November. The military continued airstrikes and ground operations against ISIS-inspired Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Fighters (BIFF) in an area of marshland between the provinces of Maguindanao and Cotobato (at the border of Maguindanao's Datu Unsay and Shariff Aguak towns) on Nov 16. No casualties reported.

A group of Lumad students and teachers launched a camp-out outside the Department of Education Central Office in Pasig City, Manila on November 16, demanding that the agency acts on the attacks against indigenous alternative schools.

Around 200 farmer activists staged a demonstration rally at the gate of Central Azucarera de Tarlac in Tarlac on Nov 16 to commemorate the so-called 'Hacienda Luisita massacre' where seven farmers were killed in 2004 when soldiers and policemen retook a gate of the former sugar estate during a strike.

source: Philippine Star; Foundation for Media Alternatives
notes: A drug suspect was shot dead in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified armed men at Barangay Parian, Calamba, Laguna on November 17.

17 November. The military launched artillery attacks and ground assaults against the Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Fighters (BIFF) in Carmen, North Cotabato on Nov 17. Army soldiers were joined by fighters of the Moro Islamic Liberation Front in Barangay Tonganon. No casualties reported.

17 November. The military launched artillery attacks and ground assaults against the Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Fighters (BIFF) in Carmen, North Cotabato on Nov 17. Army soldiers were joined by fighters of the Moro Islamic Liberation Front in Barangay Bentangon. No casualties reported.

17 November. The military continued airstrikes and ground operations against ISIS-inspired Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Fighters (BIFF) in an area of marshland between the provinces of Maguindanao and Cotobato (at the border of Maguindanao's Datu Unsay and Shariff Aguak towns) on Nov 17. No casualties reported.

Non-violent activity: Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Fighters (BIFF) militants attacked the Gani Abpi College in Datu Unsay town, Maguindanao on Nov 17. (It is unclear why the BIFF targeted the college and if civilians were targeted, but soldiers were patrolling the town regularly.)
A government soldier was wounded as Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Fighters (BIFF) militants attacked an Army base at in Barangay Timbangan, Shariff Aguak town, Maguindanao on Nov 17.
Suspected New People's Army (NPA) rebels disarmed and shot dead an Army soldier at Barangay Anislag, Daraga, Albay on November 18. The victim was alone at a public market when he was attacked.
A drug suspect was killed during a police raid at Lucena, Quezon on 18 Nov 2017.
Two soldiers were wounded when a grenade thrown by suspected New People's Army (NPA) rebels exploded at the municipal building in Cayawan town in Masbate province on November 18 night.
A policeman was shot dead by a unidentified motorcycle-riding gunman while he was drinking outside his house in Pasay City on November 18. The motive of the attack is still under investigation.

Suspected members of the BIFF fired rocket-propelled grenades toward a college compound in Datu Piang, Maguindanao, Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao on 19 November. Police suspect that the BIFF was trying to intimidate students. There were no casualties.

actor2: Military Forces of the Philippines (2016-) Philippine Navy
notes: Navy seals, along with the police, captured six suspected members of the Abu Sayaff harassing a fishingboat near the town of Tongkil, Sulu, Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao on 20 November. One of the persons captured is suspected of being a gun-for-hire and perpetrator behind a 2007 bombing. No injuries were noted.

Government troops launched continued bombing of BIFF positions at Barangay Tonganon in Aleosan, Cotabato, Soccskargen. (Days of campaign are not known, assumed it lastedd until 21 Nov.) The military had reports of casualties, but no confirmed number.
A drug suspect was killed during a police raid at Kalingalan Caluang, Sulu on 21 Nov 2017.

Troops of the 602nd Infantry Brigade retook territory formerly occupied by the BIFF at a village in Carmen, Cotabato, Soccskargen, on 22 November. The BIFF had abandoned the camp after days of bombing by the military.

assoc_actor_2: Military Forces of the Philippines (2016-) Citizen Armed Force Geographical Unit
notes: The New People's Army had an encounter with troops of the 23d Infantry Battalion and CAFGUs at Barangay Kamagong in Nasipit, Agusan del Sur, Caraga on 22 November. The military and the CAFGUs attacked the NPA. NPA claims to have killed 2 CAFGUs and 1 military; the government claims that only 1 soldier was killed. NPA reovered military equipment.

Troops of the 602nd Infantry Brigade seized two camps formerly occupied by the BIFF at Barangay Tonganon in Aleosan, Cotabato, Soccskargen on 22 November. The BIFF had abandoned the camp after days of bombing by the military.
Defusal: The police, along with civilians, succeeded in defusing an IED left by an unidentified armed group in midst of a festival in the city of Isulan, Sultan Kudarat, Soccskargen on 22 November.
The New People's Army killed a caretaker of a construction company in Barangay Putlan in Carranglan, Nueva Ecija, Central Luzon on 22 November.

assoc_actor_2: Farmers (Philippines); KMP: Kilusang Magbubukid ng Pilipinas
notes: A farmer and peasant leader of the Unyon sa mga Mag-uuma sa Agusan del Norte (UMAN) affiliated to KMP was shot dead by suspected army members on 23 Nov 2017 in Barangay Calamba, Cabadbaran, Agusan del Norte. He was continuously accused by the military of being a NPA member.

A village head was killed by 4 gunmen supposedly affiliated with the drug trade in Liloan, Cebu, Central Visaya on 23 November. The village head was supposedly trying to combat drug use in his village.

Cops were ambushed by members of the NPA at Barangay Bolo in Maasin, Iloilo, Western Visayas on 24 November. The NPA used both targetted landmines and and gunfire. One cop was killed while 10 others were wounded. The NPA admitted responsibility.

Two unidentified motorcycle-riding gunmen shot dead Justine Bangay, personal aide of a Caloocan congressman, and his wife in Caloocan City, Metro Manila, National Capital Region on 24 November. There is suspicion that the killing was related to politics.

source: Front Line Defenders; Sunstar (Philippines); Davao Today; ProtectDefenders.eu
notes: A local coordinator of Anakpawis partylist was shot dead by suspected elements of the 16th Infantry Battalion at DDF village in Barangay Mandug, Buhangin, Davao del Sur on 25 Nov 2017 as reported by Anakpawis partylist and human rights organization Karapatan. He was accused of having connections with the NPA.
Property Destruction: 12 NPA destroyed quarry equipment at Barangay Orong in Kabankalan, Negros Occidental, Negros Island on 26 November. They disarmed but did not harm quarry employees.
A drug suspect was killed during a police raid at San Jose del Monte, Bulacan on 26 Nov 2017.

Troops of the 24th Infantry Battalion had an encounter with suspected members of the NPA at Barangay Ududiao in Sallapadan, Abra, Cordillera Administrative Region on 27 November. One soldier was wounded.

source: Philippine Star; Foundation for Media Alternatives
notes: A drug suspect was killed in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified gunmen at San Fernando, Pampanga on 27 Nov 2017.

The military killed 5 suspected members of the New People's Army in a military checkpoint at Barangay Aga in Nasugbu, Calabarzon, Batangas on 28 November. Possible that two of the fatalities were students.

The military killed 9 suspected members of the New People's Army at Barangay Kaylaway in Nasugbu, Batangas, Calabarzon on 28 November. They were fleeing a military checkpoint. Possible that two of the fatalities were students.

source: ProtectDefenders.eu; Davao Today; Front Line Defenders
notes: An community leader and member of the Compostela Farmers Association (CFA) was shot dead by suspected agents of the 66th Infantry Battalion at Barangay Mambusao, Compostela town, Davao de Oro on 29 Nov 2017 as reported by human rights organization Karapatan.
In the morning of 29 Nov 2017, a firefight occurred between the Gaang and Dacalan Tribe in Sorkok, Brgy. Dacalan, Tanudan, Kalinga. The feud was due to border disputes. No casualties were reported.

A farmer and member of the Agrarian Reform Beneficiary (ARB) was shot dead by 15 armed personnel of Filipinas Palm Oil Plantation Inc. (FPPI) at Barangay Maligaya, Rosario Agusan del Sur on 29 Nov 2017.

assoc_actor_2: Farmers (Philippines); KARAPATAN: Alliance for the Advancement of People's Rights; Women (Philippines)
source: Manila Times; Front Line Defenders; ProtectDefenders.eu
notes: Armed men allegedly working for a local landlord shot dead two Karapatan members, community leaders, and farmers conducting a truth-finding mission at Barangay Poblacion in Bayawan, Negros Oriental, Negros Island on 30 Nov 2017. The local landlord allegedly behind the attack was embroiled in a dispute with local farmers. 1 other activist was injured.

Groups associated with Bayan organized a protest against the government's supposed plan of declaring a revolutionary government at a monument in Manila, Metro Manila, National Capital Region on 30 Nov.
Bayan organized a protest against the government's supposed plan of declaring a revolutionary government at a street in Bacolod (Negros Island, Negros Occidental) on 30 Nov.

Anakbayan organized a protest against the government's supposed plan of declaring a revolutionary government at an avenue in President Duterte's hometown, Davao City, Davao del Sur, Davao Region on 30 Nov.

Partido Manggagawa (Labor party) organized a protest against the government's supposed plan of declaring a revolutionary government near a plaza in Bacolod, Negros Occidental, Negros Island on 30 Nov.

Police attacked activists demonstrating against Duterte's threat of imposing a revolutionary government in the city of Manila, Metro Manila, National Capital Region on November 30. The demonstrators defended themselves from police who used water cannons and other means. There were a number of injuries on both sides.
BMP organized a protest against the government's supposed plan of declaring a revolutionary government along a fountain in Bacolod, Negros Occidental, Negros Island on 30 Nov.
